text: I've noticed that thermostats in UK hotel rooms and vehicles are graduated by 0.5 degree C, which is just a bit less than 1 degree F. That must be the right granularity for adjusting temperature for human comfort.

text: Metric units are simpler for scientific calculation, but imperial units are scaled for human use in everyday life.
